item.title: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server
item.dc:creator: @RuneOnline RuneOnline
item.description:
@RuneOnline wrote:

[quote=“lostmyphat, post:40, topic:439233”][quote author=bananaman link=topic=541933.msg4085198#msg4085198 date=1345753845]
Using this, thanks I have an issue though.

I can’t pick the items up :S any idea why?
[/quote]

had the same problem you have to edit some stuff in the process for itemhandler[/quote]

Can you help me out?

[code]

public void process() {
	for (int i = 0; i <= 5000; i++) {
		if (globalItemID[i] != 0)
			globalItemTicks[i]++;

		if ((hideItemTimer + showItemTimer) == globalItemTicks[i]) {
			// misc.println("Item Removed ["+i+"] id is ["+globalItemID[i]+"]");
			if (!globalItemStatic[i]) {
				removeItemAll(globalItemID[i], globalItemX[i],
						globalItemY[i]);
			} else {
				misc.println("Item is static");
			}
		}

		if (showItemTimer == globalItemTicks[i]) { // Phate: Item has
			// expired, show to all
			if (!globalItemStatic[i]) {
				createItemAll(globalItemID[i], globalItemX[i],
						globalItemY[i], globalItemAmount[i],
						globalItemController[i]);
			} else
				misc.println("Item is static");
		}

	}
}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server

item.title: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server
item.dc:creator: @pitchblac23 pitchblac23
item.description:
@pitchblac23 wrote:

private void createGlobalDrop(int, int, int, int, int) {

You have 6 ints, it's only required to have 5, it's also not necessary to have 'int height' as it's very rare you'd drop something above heightLevel 0.

i know i have 6 ints and need 5 but there’s many drops above lvl 0 like in lumby castle 3 floors and in cooks guild there’s 2 floors there i just wondering how to make it work im stuck on this

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server

item.title: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“pitchblac23, post:32, topic:439233”]i have tryed to add in height to this but keep failing with one error. Anyone know how to add the height to the droped items ? I can see my reasion pretty easyly but I dont understand it for a fix

Compiler -by RandQm
Current Time Wed 07/04/2012 22:49:41.40

Compiling…
errors:
GlobalDrops.java:34: error: method createItemAll in class ItemHandler cannot be
applied to given types;
ItemHandler.createItemAll(itemId, itemX, itemY, amount, height,
ItemHandler.globalItemController[index]);
^
required: int,int,int,int,int
found: int,int,int,int,int,int
reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length
1 error
Compiling Finished.
By RandQm

//edited code for height
private void createGlobalDrop(int itemId, int itemX, int itemY, int amount, int height) {
int index = 0;
ItemHandler.createItemAll(itemId, itemX, itemY, amount, height, ItemHandler.globalItemController[index]);
}[/quote]
Read the [tt]createGlobalDrop[/tt] method, then the error.

private void createGlobalDrop(int, int, int, int, int) {
You have 6 ints, it’s only required to have 5, it’s also not necessary to have ‘int height’ as it’s very rare you’d drop something above heightLevel 0.

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server

item.title: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server
item.dc:creator: @pitchblac23 pitchblac23
item.description:
@pitchblac23 wrote:

i have tryed to add in height to this but keep failing with one error. Anyone know how to add the height to the droped items ? I can see my reasion pretty easyly but I dont understand it for a fix

Compiler -by RandQm
Current Time Wed 07/04/2012 22:49:41.40

Compiling…
errors:
GlobalDrops.java:34: error: method createItemAll in class ItemHandler cannot be
applied to given types;
ItemHandler.createItemAll(itemId, itemX, itemY, amount, height,
ItemHandler.globalItemController[index]);
^
required: int,int,int,int,int
found: int,int,int,int,int,int
reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length
1 error
Compiling Finished.
By RandQm

//edited code for height
private void createGlobalDrop(int itemId, int itemX, int itemY, int amount, int height) {
int index = 0;
ItemHandler.createItemAll(itemId, itemX, itemY, amount, height, ItemHandler.globalItemController[index]);
}

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server
item.dc:creator: @The_Unholy The Unholy
item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 4 at ItemHandler.loadDrops(ItemHandler.java:218) at ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:174) at server.main(server.java:113)

I get this error in my run, my tabs and spaces are perfect so I don’t see the issue?

[code]//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// INFORMATION ABOUT THE USAGE OF THIS FILE //
// //
// Add a new drop in this format: //
// drop = itemID - Xcoordinate - Ycoordinate - itemAmount //
// " - " means you must put a TAB //
// You can also add info at the end of the line (optional) //
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

//Example:

drop(space)=(space558(tab)3024(tab)3885(tab)2

[ENDOFDROPLIST] //Do not remove this![/code]

How do I fix this?

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server
item.dc:creator: @Mario_PvP Mario PvP
item.description:
@Mario_PvP wrote:

Quote from: RandQm on April 12, 2012, 05:29:58 PM 
Quote from: kickingjamie on April 12, 2012, 05:13:55 PM

    Quote from: RandQm on April 12, 2012, 05:09:23 PM

        Quote from: kickingjamie on April 12, 2012, 04:56:41 PM

            Your example gives me exceptions
            Code: [Select]
            Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "5
            58        3206        3208        1        LUMBRIDGE CASTLE MIND RUNE"
                    at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source)
                    at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
                    at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
                    at ItemHandler.loadDrops(ItemHandler.java:214)
                    at ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:174)
                    at server.main(server.java:114)
            Anyone else get the same thing?


        check for tabs and spaces


    I checked lol.. I'm not that special..


try removing the explanation "LUMBRIDGE CASTLE MIND RUNE"

Doesn’t fix it.


try using LUMBRIDGE_CASTLE_MIND_RUNE you see? with the lower -

item.source: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server

item.title: [Delta] Adding Global Drops to your server
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“FFkingdom, post:22, topic:439233”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=541933.msg3979148#msg3979148 date=1335035191]

First off, thank you for this. It was nice to finally have drops appear in the game as they should…sort of lol.

I have only one real issue.

Before that, I had to, rather than add your globaldrops page, make my current one the one. (Yours did not work with my client, I believe because mine has height and type in it.)

My only issue is the things that should appear on floor 1, 2, 3, or 4 appear on all floors. Is there a means to making them just appear on the floor they belong on only?

Otherwise it is working quite well, and loving it overall. A big thank you for making it work

I don’t really know what you mean by the floors thing
[/quote]
Kind of an example:
There should be grapes and a jug on the 3rd floor (heightLevel == 2) of the cooking guild. But rather they show on all heightLevels, not just the floor they belong on.[/quote]

Oh I never thought about height level, that’s why
But I’m pretty sure you can add that.

edit: checked for me, it just spawns on 0 not on others

Read full topic

[quote=“RandQm, post:21, topic:439233”][quote author=FFkingdom link=topic=541933.msg3978620#msg3978620 date=1334969072]
First off, thank you for this. It was nice to finally have drops appear in the game as they should…sort of lol.

I have only one real issue.

Before that, I had to, rather than add your globaldrops page, make my current one the one. (Yours did not work with my client, I believe because mine has height and type in it.)

My only issue is the things that should appear on floor 1, 2, 3, or 4 appear on all floors. Is there a means to making them just appear on the floor they belong on only?

Otherwise it is working quite well, and loving it overall. A big thank you for making it work
[/quote]

I don’t really know what you mean by the floors thing[/quote]
Kind of an example:
There should be grapes and a jug on the 3rd floor (heightLevel == 2) of the cooking guild. But rather they show on all heightLevels, not just the floor they belong on.
